_meta.description: Prompts for LLM to generate landing page copy. Focus on conversion and clarity.
_meta.note: Landing page is the first impression. Every word should drive towards signup/trial.

hero.badge: Optional badge above headline. Create credibility or urgency. Ex: 'Trusted by 10k+ founders', 'Production-ready', '#1 on Product Hunt'
hero.titleStart: First part of headline if split design is used. Can be descriptive. Ex: 'Build Your'
hero.titleHighlight: Highlighted/colored part of headline. Your unique value prop. Ex: 'AI SaaS', 'Dream App', product name
hero.titleEnd: Ending of headline. The transformation/outcome. Ex: 'Faster Than Ever', 'In Days, Not Months', 'Without Code'
hero.subtitle: Expand on headline. 1-2 sentences. Address WHO this is for and HOW it helps. Include key differentiator.
hero.cta: Primary action button. Be specific about what happens next. Ex: 'Start Free Trial', 'Get Started Free', 'See It in Action'
hero.viewPricing: Secondary button to pricing. Ex: 'View Pricing', 'See Plans', 'Compare Options'

features.label: Section eyebrow/label. Ex: 'Features', 'What's Included', 'Everything You Need'
features.title: Section heading. Create desire or emphasize completeness. Ex: 'Everything you need to ship fast', 'Built for speed', 'Your complete toolkit'
features.description: Subheading explaining the value. Focus on time saved or pain removed. Ex: 'Stop rebuilding the same features. Focus on what makes your product unique.'

featureItems._note: Each feature should have name + description. Focus on BENEFITS, not just features.
featureItems.name: Feature name. Benefit-oriented. Ex: 'Auth with Supabase' â†’ emphasize 'with Supabase' for credibility
featureItems.description: What it does + why it matters. ~10-15 words. Ex: 'Email/password, magic links, and OAuth providers. Session management included.'
featureItems.learnMore: Link text to feature details. Ex: 'Learn more', 'See how it works'

stats._note: Impressive numbers that build confidence. Use concrete metrics.
stats.setupTime: Label for setup speed. Ex: 'Setup time', 'Time to launch'
stats.components: Label for component count. Ex: 'Components', 'Ready-to-use components'
stats.typeSafe: Label for type safety. Ex: 'Type-safe', 'TypeScript coverage'
stats.vendorLockIn: Label for vendor independence. Ex: 'Vendor lock-in', 'Dependencies'

tech.label: Section eyebrow. Ex: 'Tech Stack', 'Built With', 'Technology'
tech.title: Section heading. Emphasize quality/modernity. Ex: 'Built with modern tech', 'Production-ready stack', 'Technologies you trust'
tech.description: Why the tech stack matters. Ex: 'Production-ready stack you already know and love', 'Battle-tested technologies, zero learning curve'

social_proof._note: Build trust through testimonials, logos, or stats
social_proof.title: Section heading. Ex: 'Loved by founders', 'Join 10,000+ builders', 'Trusted by teams at'
social_proof.testimonialQuote: Actual result or transformation achieved. Include metrics when possible. Ex: 'Launched my SaaS in 3 days instead of 3 months'
social_proof.testimonialAuthor: Name + role/company. Ex: 'Sarah Chen, Founder of TaskFlow'
social_proof.testimonialRole: Job title or company. Ex: 'Founder, TaskFlow' or 'Engineering Lead at Acme'

cta.title: Create urgency or reinforce value. Ex: 'Ready to ship faster?', 'Start building today', 'Join thousands of founders'
cta.description: Remove friction, reassure. Ex: 'Get started in 60 seconds. No credit card required.', 'Join 10,000+ founders who chose to ship instead of build infrastructure.'
cta.button: Match or vary hero CTA slightly. Ex: 'Start Free Trial', 'Get Started Now'
